intro: Alkanna bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored alkanna, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Alkanna bicolor is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
